inclusion.criterion: Body weight of at least 25 pounds
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: diagnosis of Lennox-Gastaut syndrome and an electroencephalogram (EEG) with an abnormal pulsation pattern
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: atypical absence seizures and drop attacks (i.e., tonic-atonic seizures) among other seizure types that could include tonic-clonic, myoclonic, and minor-motor
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: at least 60 seizures during the month before baseline
inclusion.label: not_met

inclusion.criterion: must be maintained on 1 or 2 antiepileptic drugs
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: females must not have had their first menstrual period, or are physically incapable of child bearing, or if of child bearing potential, sexually abstinent, or using adequate contraceptive measures, and have a negative pregnancy test before study entry.
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Patients whose seizures are due to a progressive disease (for example, active infection, cancer or metabolic disturbance)
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: have a significant recent history (within 2 years) of medical diseases (respiratory, heart, gastrointestinal, blood diseases, rheumatic fever or cancer)
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: history of alcohol or drug abuse
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: Patient has a history of severe intellectual disability, CHF, and epilepsy. He presented with facial twitching on the right and generalized shaking in his NH which required 20 mg valium to cease seizure activity.
